intro: Dracaena oldupai, commonly known as the Oldupai dracaena, is a species of flowering plant in the Asparagaceae family. It is native to Tanzania and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and narrow, sword-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous white flowers that appear in clusters at the tips of the stems. Dracaena oldupai is adapted to arid environments and requires well-draining soil and minimal water. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its elegant appearance and resilience.
